meanings.definition: In a magnificent or grand manner.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display lit up the night sky splendidly.
meanings.sent2: She sang splendidly at the talent show and received a standing ovation.
meanings.sent3: The little girl twirled splendidly in her princess costume, pretending to be a royal queen.
meanings.sent4: The sun set splendidly over the horizon, painting the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The grand castle stood splendidly on top of the hill, a symbol of power and majesty.

meanings.definition: In a very impressive or excellent way.
meanings.sent1: The chef cooked the meal splendidly, earning praise from all the guests.
meanings.sent2: The team worked splendidly together to complete the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat splendidly, leaving the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The athlete ran splendidly, breaking the world record with ease.
meanings.sent5: The orchestra played the symphony splendidly, moving the audience to tears with their music.
